title: Checkbox - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for checkbox groups with multiple selection, vertical/horizontal layouts, and custom styling

examples.name: Skills/Interests Selection (6 Options, Vertical)
examples.description: Multi-select checkbox group for user skills or interests with vertical stacking layout
examples.visualDescription: Six square checkboxes stacked vertically, each with descriptive label, purple theme, allows multiple selections

attributes.error: Please select at least one skill.

examples.useCase: Job applications, freelancer profiles, skill assessments, user onboarding, portfolio setup

checkboxGroupDetails.fldOptions: Array of checkbox options - each has fldLabel (display text) and fldValue (submitted value)
checkboxGroupDetails.optPos: vertical - Checkboxes stack vertically (one per line)
checkboxGroupDetails.reqTgl: true - User must select at least one option (prevents empty submission)

bestPractices: Use underscore_case for fldValue (web_design) for backend processing
Keep fldLabel descriptive and user-friendly (Frontend Development)
Set reqTgl: true if at least one selection is mandatory
Use vertical layout (optPos: vertical) for better readability with 4+ options

examples.name: Newsletter Topics (Horizontal, Rounded Checkboxes)
examples.description: Newsletter subscription topics in horizontal layout with rounded checkbox styling
examples.visualDescription: Four rounded checkboxes in horizontal row, blue theme, help text explains what each topic includes

attributes.desctxt: Select all topics you'd like to receive via email. You can unsubscribe anytime.

examples.useCase: Newsletter signups, email preferences, notification settings, subscription management

layoutDetails.optPos: horizontal - Checkboxes display in a row (side by side)
layoutDetails.bRadius: rounded - Rounded corners for softer appearance
layoutDetails.hlpTxt: true - Show help text to explain options
layoutDetails.descPoss: top - Help text appears above checkboxes

warnings: Horizontal layout works best with 2-5 options (too many wraps awkwardly on mobile)
On mobile, horizontal checkboxes may stack vertically automatically (depends on label length)
Ensure adequate spacing between checkboxes in horizontal layout for touch targets

examples.name: Terms & Conditions Agreement (Single Checkbox, Required)
examples.description: Single required checkbox for legal agreement acceptance
examples.visualDescription: Single square checkbox with 'I agree to Terms and Conditions' label, required field with custom error message

fldOptions.fldLabel: I agree to the Terms and Conditions and Privacy Policy

attributes.error: You must agree to the Terms and Conditions to proceed.
attributes.desctxt: By checking this box, you confirm that you have read and accept our Terms and Conditions.

examples.useCase: Registration forms, checkout pages, legal agreements, GDPR consent, account creation

singleCheckboxPattern.fldOptions: Array with ONE item for single checkbox
singleCheckboxPattern.reqTgl: true - Must be checked to submit form
singleCheckboxPattern.error: Descriptive error mentioning what user must agree to
singleCheckboxPattern.legalCompliance: Store timestamp and IP with acceptance for audit trail

bestPractices: Include link to actual Terms & Conditions in fldLabel (e.g., Terms and Conditions)
Use descriptive error message explaining requirement
Consider adding help text with summary of key terms
For GDPR compliance, log acceptance timestamp and IP address in backend

examples.name: Services Selection (E-Commerce, 50% Width)

examples.visualDescription: Five service checkboxes in vertical layout, takes 50% width on desktop, stacks to full width on mobile

attributes.desctxt: Select any additional services you'd like to add to your order.

examples.useCase: E-commerce checkout, product customization, add-on services, subscription upgrades

pricingPattern.fldLabel: Include price in label for transparency (Gift Wrapping +$5)
pricingPattern.fldValue: Encode price in value (gift_wrap_5) for backend calculation
pricingPattern.calculation: Backend extracts price from fldValue to calculate total
pricingPattern.example: fldValue 'express_ship_15' → extract '15' → add $15 to order total

responsiveLayout.md: 50% - Half width on desktop (pair with product summary or delivery options)
responsiveLayout.sm: 100% - Full width on tablet and mobile (stacks vertically)

relatedBlocks: Pair with another checkbox group (Services 50% + Delivery Options 50%)

examples.name: Privacy & Marketing Consent (GDPR Compliant)
examples.description: Multi-checkbox consent form with granular privacy options for GDPR compliance
examples.visualDescription: Four separate consent checkboxes, first is required (Terms), others optional (Marketing, Analytics, Third-party), help text explains each

fldOptions.fldLabel: I consent to receive marketing emails (Optional)
I consent to sharing data with trusted partners (Optional)

attributes.error: You must accept the Terms & Conditions to proceed.
attributes.desctxt: We respect your privacy. You can change these preferences anytime in your account settings.

examples.useCase: GDPR-compliant registrations, cookie consent, privacy settings, marketing opt-ins

gdprCompliance.required: Terms & Conditions acceptance (first checkbox with reqTgl: true)
gdprCompliance.optional: Marketing, analytics, third-party sharing (clearly labeled as Optional)
gdprCompliance.granular: Separate checkbox for each consent type (not bundled)
gdprCompliance.audit: Backend must log each consent with timestamp, IP, and user agent
gdprCompliance.withdrawal: Provide easy opt-out mechanism in account settings

warnings: GDPR requires granular consent - don't bundle marketing with terms acceptance
Only the first checkbox (Terms) should be required (reqTgl validates at least one checked)
Label optional consents clearly as '(Optional)' to avoid confusion
Backend must store separate consent records for each checkbox with timestamp
Pre-checked marketing consents violate GDPR - all must default to unchecked
legalNotes: Terms & Conditions checkbox is typically required for contract formation
Marketing consent must be optional and clearly separate from Terms
Analytics/cookies consent often required under GDPR/ePrivacy directive
Third-party data sharing requires explicit informed consent
Consent must be freely given, specific, informed, and unambiguous

examples.name: Days of the Week (Availability Schedule, Horizontal)
examples.description: Seven checkboxes for day-of-week selection in horizontal row layout
examples.visualDescription: Seven rounded checkboxes in a row (Mon-Sun), compact design for availability scheduling

attributes.error: Please select at least one day of availability.
attributes.desctxt: Select all days you are available for appointments.

examples.useCase: Appointment scheduling, availability calendars, shift selection, booking systems, recurring events

weekdayPattern.abbreviations: Use short labels (Mon, Tue, Wed) for compact horizontal layout
weekdayPattern.full_values: Use full day names in fldValue (monday, tuesday) for clarity in backend
weekdayPattern.order: Start with Monday (ISO 8601 standard) or Sunday (US convention)
weekdayPattern.all_seven: Include all 7 days for complete week coverage

bestPractices: Use abbreviated labels (Mon-Sun) for horizontal layout to fit in one row
Consider using full names (Monday-Sunday) if layout is vertical
Use lowercase full names in fldValue (monday) for consistent backend processing
For business hours, pair with time fields (nxt-time-field) for each selected day

examples.name: Dietary Restrictions (Food Allergies, Medical Context)
examples.description: Common dietary restrictions and food allergies for catering, events, or health forms
examples.visualDescription: Eight vertical checkboxes for allergies and dietary preferences, medical/health context with serious tone

attributes.desctxt: Please select all dietary restrictions or allergies that apply. This information is critical for meal planning.

examples.useCase: Event registration, catering orders, restaurant reservations, health forms, school cafeteria

medicalContext.severity: Indicate severity in label (Nut Allergy - Severe) for critical allergies
medicalContext.clarity: Use medical terms when appropriate (Celiac, Lactose Intolerant)
medicalContext.religious: Include religious dietary laws (Kosher, Halal) separate from allergies
medicalContext.liability: Help text should emphasize importance for safety/health reasons

warnings: Food allergies can be life-threatening - treat this data with utmost care
Backend must flag severe allergies (nut, shellfish) for special attention
Don't make this field required (not everyone has dietary restrictions)
Consider adding free-text field for unlisted allergies or additional details
bestPractices: Use clear, specific labels (Lactose Intolerant / Dairy-Free vs just Dairy)
Separate preferences (vegetarian) from medical allergies (nut allergy) visually if possible
Include severity indicators for life-threatening allergies (Severe)
Provide additional notes field for specific details (e.g., nxt-message-field below)

Use AJAX to update product results without page reload for better UX

Provide 'Clear All' button to reset all checkbox selections

validationRules.labelss: Required string - Field label/heading for checkbox group
validationRules.fldOptions: Required array - List of checkbox options (minimum 1)
validationRules.fldOptions[].fldLabel: Required string - Display text shown to user
validationRules.fldOptions[].fldValue: Required string - Value submitted to backend (use lowercase, underscores)
validationRules.reqTgl: Boolean - true requires at least one checkbox checked, false makes all optional
validationRules.uniqueid: String - Unique form field identifier for submission data

warnings: reqTgl: true only validates that AT LEAST ONE checkbox is checked (not all, not specific ones)
There's no built-in way to require specific checkboxes - use custom JavaScript or backend validation
Horizontal layout (optPos: horizontal) can wrap awkwardly with 6+ options on mobile
bRadius only affects checkbox styling, not layout or functionality
Checkbox values are submitted as array if multiple selected (backend must handle arrays)
No way to set default checked state in block.json - requires JavaScript or backend pre-population
chkPosition styling may not work consistently across all themes
Long fldLabel text in horizontal layout causes wrapping - keep labels concise (1-3 words)
GDPR requires granular consent - don't bundle required terms with optional marketing in same checkbox
Pre-checked checkboxes for marketing violate GDPR - all must default unchecked
commonMistakes: Using reqTgl: true to require ALL checkboxes (it only requires at least one)
Bundling Terms acceptance with marketing opt-in in same checkbox (GDPR violation)
Using horizontal layout with 10+ checkboxes (wraps poorly on mobile)
Using spaces or special characters in fldValue (use underscores: 'gift_wrap' not 'Gift Wrap')
Not providing descriptive error messages (use 'Select at least one skill' not 'Required field')
Making dietary restrictions required (not everyone has restrictions)
Using generic fldValue like 'option1' instead of descriptive 'web_design'
Forgetting to handle checkbox array data in backend (multiple selections = array)
Not testing mobile layout for horizontal checkboxes (may need vertical on small screens)
Including prices in fldValue instead of fldLabel (put '$5' in label, 'gift_wrap_5' in value)
bestPractices: Use descriptive fldValue names (web_design, marketing_opt_in) not generic (option1, option2)
Keep fldValue lowercase with underscores for consistent backend processing
Use vertical layout (optPos: vertical) for 4+ options for better readability
Use horizontal layout (optPos: horizontal) only for 2-5 short options (Yes/No, Mon-Fri)
Set reqTgl: true for skill selections, interests, required choices
Set reqTgl: false for optional preferences, dietary restrictions, add-on services
Provide specific error messages: 'Select at least one day of availability' not 'This field is required'
Use help text (hlpTxt + desctxt) to explain what happens with selected options
For GDPR consent, separate required terms from optional marketing (different checkbox groups)
Include prices in fldLabel for transparency (Gift Wrapping +$5) and encode in fldValue (gift_wrap_5)
Use abbreviations in horizontal layouts (Mon, Tue, Wed) to prevent wrapping
For single checkbox (Terms), always set reqTgl: true to enforce acceptance
Test checkbox touch targets on mobile (minimum 44x44px) for accessibility
Use uniqueid that describes the field purpose ('user_skills', 'newsletter_topics')
accessibilityNotes: Label (labelss) is required for screen readers to identify checkbox group purpose
Each fldLabel is announced individually by screen readers as checkbox label
Use descriptive fldLabel text: 'I agree to Terms and Conditions' not just 'Agree'
Help text (desctxt) provides additional context for assistive technology
Error messages (error attribute) are announced by screen readers when validation fails
Checkboxes are keyboard accessible (Tab to navigate, Space to toggle)
Ensure sufficient color contrast for checkbox borders (minimum 3:1 ratio)
Don't rely on color alone to indicate checked state (use checkmark icon)
Group related checkboxes under clear heading (labelss) for screen reader navigation
Large touch targets on mobile (minimum 44x44px) - TPGB default styling handles this
performanceConsiderations: Browser native checkbox rendering is instant (no custom JavaScript needed)
Large number of checkboxes (50+) may slow down form rendering
Checkbox validation happens on submit, not on every click
Vertical layout performs better on mobile than horizontal (no wrapping calculations)
If using dynamic checkboxes, debounce filtering logic to avoid excessive re-renders

vertical.bestFor: 4+ options, long labels, default choice for most forms
vertical.spacing: Each checkbox on separate line for easy scanning
vertical.mobile: Works perfectly on mobile (no wrapping issues)

horizontal.bestFor: 2-5 options, short labels (1-3 words), compact UI
horizontal.spacing: Checkboxes in a row, may wrap on mobile if too many
horizontal.mobile: Test carefully - long labels cause wrapping, consider vertical for mobile

NewsletterSignups.example: Topics (News, Updates, Offers, Events) - all optional

ECommerceCheckout.tip: Use checkboxes for add-on services, include prices in labels
ECommerceCheckout.example: Services (Gift Wrapping +$5, Express Shipping +$15, Extended Warranty +$25)

GDPRConsent.tip: Separate required Terms checkbox from optional marketing consent

GDPRConsent.example: Group 1: Terms (required), Group 2: Marketing, Analytics, Third-party (all optional)

AppointmentBooking.tip: Use horizontal layout for day-of-week selection (Mon-Sun), abbreviated labels
AppointmentBooking.validation: Set reqTgl: true (user must select at least one day)
AppointmentBooking.example: Available Days (Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun)
